Position.Title: Arts Initiatives Advisor
Position.BriefRoleStatement: Directing the Schools Spectacular and support State Office personnel through the initiation, development, coordination and delivery of associated projects.
Position.StatementOfDuties:
• Building the capacity of teachers through the development of professional learning opportunities and activities associated to Schools Spectacular and associated projects.
  • Contributing to unit-wide programs and planning as required.
  • Coordinating the development and delivery of project plans for the Schools Spectacular and associated projects.
  • Directing the Schools Spectacular, developing its concept, chairing the creative team and coordinating related production and technical teams.
  • Liaising and negotiating with Public Schools NSW and external key stakeholders related to the Schools Spectacular and other related projects.
  • Overseeing the development and direction of staging and technical design of the Schools Spectacular.
  • Preparing budgets, action plans, briefings, web materials and reports relating to the direction of the Schools Spectacular and associated projects.
  • SPECIAL CONDITION: Hours of work in the Arts Unit are currently determined in accordance with Determination No. 2 of 2011. At times Arts Unit employees are required to work in the evening and on weekends. A per annum allowance is payable to reflect these circumstances.
  • Supervising the work of related support staff.

SelectionCriteria.Criteria: Teaching qualifications and recent school based experience within the K-12 range
Demonstrated commitment to participating in and managing accreditation processes
Proven ability to liaise and negotiate with a range of stakeholders and work collaboratively within and across teams
High level written and oral communication and interpersonal skills and experience in the preparation of documents including briefings, reports and correspondence
Demonstrated capacity to lead and supervise staff, monitor high standards and work effectively as part of a management team
Proven ability to meet deadlines, provide sound advice and work independently
Demonstrated capacity to ensure that projects are delivered on time, within budget and in accordance with agreed quality standards
Demonstrated ability to develop, plan and implement strategic initiatives and innovative practices that support education change for improved student learning outcomes
Knowledge of and commitment to the Department's Aboriginal education policies
